definition: next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: The loquat in the yard has got ripe gradually.
sentences.chinese: 院子里的枇杷渐次熟了。

sentences.english: This in turn could lead to a gradual transition to Chinese-style market economics.
sentences.chinese: 接下来可能会导致向中国特色市场经济的渐次转型。

sentences.english: Flower-de- luce climbed all the braes one by one to overlook the visit of darkness like Psalters.
sentences.chinese: 鸢尾花渐次爬上所有的山坡，眺望黑色的诗篇降临。

sentences.english: Perhaps the moment I shut our eyes, gradually declining pyrotechnics.
sentences.chinese: 也许那一刻我闭上眼，烟火渐次凋零。

sentences.english: Eliminates sadness and sufferings in Six Paths, increases Six Paramita gradually.
sentences.chinese: 解脱六道之苦和六波罗蜜渐次增长。

sentences.english: Thus, people living in buildings under gradually embarked on a rich color.
sentences.chinese: 于是，生活在建筑的附丽下，渐次展开了丰富的色彩。

sentences.english: The last ray of the sun had already faded from the cloud-edges.
sentences.chinese: 太阳的余辉已经渐次消失在云端里。

sentences.english: Many experiences little by little destroyed all the faith which I had rested in my senses.
sentences.chinese: 后来，经验渐多，便使我信仰感官的心理渐次减退了。

definition: to become more and more/to gradually become
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
to thin out gradually/to become fainter and fainter
to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
